content: ExxonMobil's Tze San Koh explains how natural gas is supporting a brighter future.
bio:
The need for energy is universal. That's why ExxonMobil scientists and engineers are pioneering new research and pursuing new technologies to reduce emissions while creating more efficient fuels. 

We're committed to responsibly meeting the world's energy needs.

We aim to achieve #netzero emissions from our operated assets by 2050 (for Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions) and are taking a comprehensive approach to create emission-reduction roadmaps for major operated assets. 
 
▶️Subscribe for the latest in lower-emission technologies and advancements.

post_body_text: ExxonMobil successfully delivered the first cargo of certified Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) to Changi Airport as part of a one-year pilot launched by the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore, Singapore Airlines and Temasek. The SAF is manufactured by blending ExxonMobil-produced refined jet fuel with the Neste-produced neat SAF at ExxonMobil facilities in Singapore.
title: ExxonMobil's First Certified Blended Sustainable Aviation Fuel Delivery to Singapore Changi Airport
content: ExxonMobil successfully delivered the first cargo of certified Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) to Changi Airport as part of a one-year pilot launched by the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore, Singapore Airlines and Temasek. The SAF is manufactured by blending ExxonMobil-produced refined jet fuel with the Neste-produced neat SAF at ExxonMobil facilities in Singapore.

post_body_text: Hydrogen—a condensed history: 🗓 1671: Humans discover this abundant element 🗓 1900: The first hydrogen-filled airship launches 🗓 1943: Liquid hydrogen is tested as rocket fuel 🗓 2016: Hydrogen fuel cell car launches 2022 and beyond? Using #carboncapture and our expertise to help produce hydrogen at greater scale At our Baytown, Texas, plant we’re planning to build a facility that would produce blue hydrogen by breaking down natural gas into CO2 and H2. When we store the CO2 deep underground, we are left with H2 as a low-emission fuel for future use. It’s one of the ways we’re advancing climate solutions. #energytransition

title: Powering Vehicles on the Road to Net-Zero | ExxonMobil
content:
What if we could make the world's hardest working vehicles lower emission vehicles? Watch to find out how ExxonMobil is working to do just that. 

Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1

From renewable diesel made from plants to advanced biofuels made from wood waste, we're working to develop energy-ready fuels that could help reduce emissions by up to 85% compared to conventional fuels.

Learn more at https://www.exxonmobil.com/fuels.

Take a peek into the future of lower emission transportation fuels:
https://energyfactor.exxonmobil.com/insights/the-future-of-lower-emission-transportation-fuels/ 

Hear from ExxonMobil Senior Technology Advisor, Tim McMinn, on biofuels:
https://energyfactor.exxonmobil.com/reducing-emissions/alternative-fuels/a-bio-fueled-future-with-tim-mcminn/ 

Discover why how renewable diesel is a sustainable solution for our changing world:
https://energyfactor.exxonmobil.com/reducing-emissions/alternative-fuels/renewable-diesel-strathcona-canada/

Follow ExxonMobil for the latest updates on sustainable energy solutions:
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil/ 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/exxonmobil 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/exxonmobil/ 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ExxonMobil/
bio:
The need for energy is universal. That's why ExxonMobil scientists and engineers are pioneering new research and pursuing new technologies to reduce emissions while creating more efficient fuels. 

We're committed to responsibly meeting the world's energy needs.

We aim to achieve #netzero emissions from our operated assets by 2050 (for Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions) and are taking a comprehensive approach to create emission-reduction roadmaps for major operated assets. 
 
▶️Subscribe for the latest in lower-emission technologies and advancements. 
 
Find us also on:
Linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil
Twitter.com/ExxonMobil
Facebook.com/ExxonMobil
Instagram.com/ExxonMobil
YouTube.com/ExxonMobil
ExxonMobil.com 

Find our latest Privacy Policy at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/Global-legal-pages/privacy-policy

See our terms and conditions, including corporate separateness, at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/global-legal-pages/terms-and-conditions

post_body_text:
In the final episode of ExxonMobil’s Talking Points video series, we meet with DNV GL at our Antwerp refinery for a game of pool to round up our IMO 2020 discussions, just weeks away from the 1st January 2020 deadline.
  
 

  DNV GL’s Christos Chryssakis, Business Development Manager, pairs up with ExxonMobil’s Luca Volta, Marine Fuels Venture Manager, and Eirik Nyhus, Director of Environment at DNV GL teams up with Joseph Star, ExxonMobil’s Global Aviation and Marine Offer Advisor. They debunk remaining industry myths and challenges likely to be faced in the immediate aftermath of IMO 2020 implementation. The discussion points cover enforcement issues, clarifying the “carriage ban”, alternative routes to compliance, cylinder oil transition, and a future beyond 2020.
  
 

  Chapters:
  
 

  • Availability and compatibility [00:43 – 02:56]
  • Lubrication and monitoring [02:57 – 06:05]
  • Enforcement and accidental non-compliance [06:06 – 10:45]
  • What is the carriage ban? [10:46 – 14:34]
  • Alternative compliance choices [14:35 – 16:27]
  • IMO 2020 myths [16:28 – 18:50]
  
 

  Missed the first five episodes of our ‘Talking Points’ series? Visit our Journey to 2020 webpage to watch the full series http://mobil.com/journey-to-2020.
title: Talking Points 06: DNV GL, Antwerp
content:
In the final episode of ExxonMobil’s Talking Points video series, we meet with DNV GL at our Antwerp refinery for a game of pool to round up our IMO 2020 discussions, just weeks away from the 1st January 2020 deadline.

DNV GL’s Christos Chryssakis, Business Development Manager, pairs up with ExxonMobil’s Luca Volta, Marine Fuels Venture Manager, and Eirik Nyhus, Director of Environment at DNV GL teams up with Joseph Star, ExxonMobil’s Global Aviation and Marine Offer Advisor. They debunk remaining industry myths and challenges likely to be faced in the immediate aftermath of IMO 2020 implementation. The discussion points cover enforcement issues, clarifying the “carriage ban”, alternative routes to compliance, cylinder oil transition, and a future beyond 2020.

Chapters:

• Availability and compatibility [00:43 – 02:56]
• Lubrication and monitoring [02:57 – 06:05]
• Enforcement and accidental non-compliance [06:06 – 10:45]
• What is the carriage ban? [10:46 – 14:34]
• Alternative compliance choices [14:35 – 16:27]
• IMO 2020 myths [16:28 – 18:50]

Missed the first five episodes of our ‘Talking Points’ series? Visit our Journey to 2020 webpage to watch the full series http://mobil.com/journey-to-2020.
bio:
Evolving environmental legislation and increased financial pressures have created many challenges for the marine industry. ExxonMobil Marine Fuels & Lubricants are committed to assisting vessel owners and operators overcome these challenges through our high quality range of products, services and expertise, across all sectors.


Subscribe now to be kept up to date with all of our latest video content.

ExxonMobil

post_body_text:
In the latest episode of ExxonMobil’s Talking Points video series, we met with the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) for a strategic discussion over a game of chess in the Port of Singapore. 
  
 

  Amidst the tactical moves, Luca Volta, Marine Fuels Venture Manager, ExxonMobil and Alan Lim, Deputy Director (Marine Services), MPA discuss the latest challenges of IMO 2020, from enforcement to alternative compliance choices such as scrubbers and LNG. 
  
 

  Chapters:
  Preparations for IMO 2020 [00:45-03:20] 
  Enforcement [03:21-05:04]
  Alternative compliance options [05:05-09:33] 
  Is the industry ready? [09:34-12:25] 
  
 

  And if you missed the first two episodes of our ‘Talking Points’ series, you can find the full series on our Journey to 2020 webpage http://mobil.com/journey-to-2020.
title: Talking Points 03: MPA, Singapore
content:
In the latest episode of ExxonMobil’s Talking Points video series, we met with the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) for a strategic discussion over a game of chess in the Port of Singapore. 

Amidst the tactical moves, Luca Volta, Marine Fuels Venture Manager, ExxonMobil and Alan Lim, Deputy Director (Marine Services), MPA discuss the latest challenges of IMO 2020, from enforcement to alternative compliance choices such as scrubbers and LNG. 

Chapters:
Preparations for IMO 2020 [00:45-03:20] 
Enforcement [03:21-05:04]
Alternative compliance options [05:05-09:33] 
Is the industry ready? [09:34-12:25] 

And if you missed the first two episodes of our ‘Talking Points’ series, you can find the full series on our Journey to 2020 webpage http://mobil.com/journey-to-2020.
bio:
Evolving environmental legislation and increased financial pressures have created many challenges for the marine industry. ExxonMobil Marine Fuels & Lubricants are committed to assisting vessel owners and operators overcome these challenges through our high quality range of products, services and expertise, across all sectors.


Subscribe now to be kept up to date with all of our latest video content.

ExxonMobil

Cat fines can destroy an engine’s liners within 1,000 hours if left unchecked. In the fourth of our “Engine Insights Series”, we explain why It is essential for vessel operators to monitor fuel quality and take proactive steps to reduce cat fine damage, rather than leaving things to chance…
  
 

  Find out more on (URL) https://www.exxonmobil.com/marine

transcript_text: [Music] today's customers in the industrial and automotive markets want more from the greases you make and satisfying those demands isn't easy as equipment size continues to shrink operating conditions grow more intense higher loads speeds and broader temperature ranges meanwhile despite these conditions your customers want longer regreasing intervals in product life as well as better performance and demand continues to grow for specialized greases such as food grade and biodegradable products greases with alternate thickeners and ones that are compatible with generic and customized additive packages that's why formulators are turning more often to synthetic base oils for help while the global grease market has grown by 0.3 percent since 2010 use of synthetic base oils has grown by six percent metallicine polyalpha olefin base stock delivers superior results in key performance areas compared to grease formulated with mineral oil or conventional pao tests show improved low temperature torque low temperature pump ability and high temperature performance how higher viscosity index enhanced film thickness and better low temperature properties along with improved shear and oxidative stability to improve grease yield and thickener efficiency while adding even better thermal and oxidative stability you can add alkylated naphthalene to your formulation engineered to provide enhanced solvency and lubricity and demonstrates excellent synergies with metallusine and conventional paos compared to mineral oil-based grease these synthetic solutions empower performance in wider temperature ranges at increased operating speeds under increasing loads and power densities and in equipment located in more remote areas that require longer product life contact your exxon mobil representative to discover how synthetic base stocks can help you make the grade innovate confidently

transcript_text: [Music] two trends dominate today's driveline industry growth of electric vehicles and growing demand for fuel economy and energy efficiency to reduce emissions these trends have fragmented the global market for light duty driveline systems preferred drivetrain styles differ by region and even within regions the heavy duty market is much more unified because electrification is at a very early stage these trends impact the driveline lubricant market including transmission axle and e-module lubes today's drivetrains generally feature higher power outputs and more compact designs higher temperatures are exceeded only by higher customer expectations for energy efficiency wear protection and fluid durability electrification requires better thermal management to meet these challenges driveline lubricant formulators are turning more than ever to synthetic base stocks a trend that's likely to continue designed to deliver higher performance at lower viscosity than mineral oil-based stocks synthetics provide exceptional oxidative and sheer stability they boost lubricant durability enabling longer drain intervals even fill for life potential in passenger vehicles and synthetic base stocks are engineered to enhance high and low temperature performance helping extend gear life through better wear protection and efficient operation perhaps most importantly synthetic base stocks allow you to target lower viscosities for increased energy efficiency without sacrificing lubricant life and wear protection to innovate today's and tomorrow's hybrid and ev fluids formulators are turning to synthetics to help achieve the optimum balance of lubrication and tribological properties with thermal management and electrification contact your exxon mobil representative to learn more about how synthetic base stocks can help you make the grade innovate confidently

post_body_text: When you need to trigger a reaction, ExxonMobil catalysts are there. Learn how our catalysts are created with your processes in ...
title: Catalyst Creation, Triggering a reaction for innovative chemical, gas and refining processes
content: When you need to trigger a reaction, ExxonMobil catalysts are there. Learn how our catalysts are created with your processes in ...
bio: ExxonMobil Chemical is one of the largest chemical companies worldwide. Our mission is to provide quality chemical products and services in the most efficient and responsible manner to generate outstanding customer and shareholder value while remaining committed to the principles of sustainable development.
transcript_text: to create quality petrochemical end products operators must first trigger a reaction and the keys that unlock this process are catalysts developed at our state-of-the-art facility in clinton new jersey our scientists work with customers here in clinton and at their facilities around the world to conceive create and test exxon mobil catalysts to ensure high quality and performance before deployment creating a catalyst begins with creating active materials through hydrothermal synthesis this process combines several raw materials into a slurry that is poured into a reactor the reactor applies heat and agitates the material which results in the formation of catalytic crystals the mulling process takes the extra day now dried into powder form and mixes them with binding agents and forms a doughy paste engineers put the paste through an extrusion machine where it is formed into long thin strands like spaghetti catalysts can be extruded in different sizes and shapes changing the shape can change the performance attributes of the catalyst now that the catalysts have been formed they enter a phase of calcination which is a heating process inside the kiln the catalyst is constantly increasing in temperature from start to finish burning off impurities to create a more pure form of the catalyst the next step is height throughput chem absorption htc a measuring process that looks at the quality and availability of metals in the catalyst these measurements give engineers an estimate of the product's catalytic performance once the catalytic characterization of the catalyst has been determined skilled exon mobile engineers test the physical properties of the catalyst this equipment measures how the catalyst performs under pressure this is a real-life simulation that allows scientists to determine how the catalyst will cope in the environments in which it will eventually be used catalysts that successfully pass through the initial development processing and testing phases are subjected to further tests to ensure they have optimum physical properties including a test that evaluates surface area after both catalytic and physical characterization has been determined the catalysts then go through catalyst activity tests that measure acidity selectivity and metal activity multiple rounds of simulations mimic a real chemical or refining process to prove the catalysts trigger a reaction and ensure consistent high yield performance when deemed fit for production the catalysts are sent to exxonmobil's beaumont laboratory for first production on a commercial scale though we have a range of options to commercially produce around the world if commercial scale production is successful global scale commercial production takes place if the commercial scale up is unsuccessful design work continues until the desired specifications are met quality control to ensure optimum performance is an important part of our commercial process and is performed at our exxonmobil global chemical technology laboratory once evaluated the catalysts are shipped to customers around the world to be used in innovative gas chemical and refining processes from start to finish our extensive catalyst creation process is designed with you in mind because of the thorough analysis of our expert staff you can trust that when your products need a reaction our innovative catalysts will be there to trigger one you

advanced but how familiar are you with this market it's time for a quick quiz question one what factors drive growth in the global hygiene market demographics urbanization higher consumer incomes more manufacturers higher adoption rate better education the truth is all of the above contribute to demand but rising incomes greater urbanization and higher adoption rate are the main factors driving growth question two what do consumers want most in a hygiene product comfort security discretion of course they want all three there has been an increase in demand for higher performing products at the same price with customers wanting softness and breathability low odor and leakage free security along with improved fit in a thin clean and safe hygiene product question three what are the solutions offered by exxonmobil chemical in the hygiene industry non-woven fabrics elastic laminates using elastics or non-wovens back sheet film hygiene construction and elastic attachment adhesives transcript_text: [Music] holland special delivery is primarily a midwest carrier we provide dry van expedited ltl service throughout the midwest we had quite a few issues with after treatment on our tractors and we were looking for a way to address some of those issues but also of course we wanted the kick and fuel economy which truly excited us we have a lot of suppliers that come in and say you know we're going to save you x amount of percent of your fuel bill and that usually never works but what really excited us is the fact that we could actually prove whether or not it worked we went to the testing facility and we were amazed we were amazed at how they did it but even more so we were amazed at the benefits we got to see all of the hard work that went into not only creating this fuel but validating it in a lab environment we decided to use diesel efficient fuel as we saw the ability to increase our fuel economy and have seen a cleaner burn which has an effect on maintenance items on the truck we experienced a two percent increase in our fuel economy and it was awesome to see the same results come through in our fleet that we experienced at the testing facility our drivers saw an increase in the performance of the truck an increase in the mileage of the truck and the ability to see less usage of diesel exhaust fluid we started seeing things coming back from our drivers that said you know i'm on the same run every day and i'm putting less fuel in my truck you know when you're a ceo of a company you love to hear that maintenance on our trucks is also an area that we see savings when you start with a truck it's two cents a mile to maintain it by the sixth year it might be 20 cents if we can maintain that at that 14 15 16 cents a mile in the sixth year that goes right to the bottom line all the trucks are set up with [Music] your exhaust gas particulate filters right so that interval could go for 350 000 miles or it could go to 450 000 miles we have a cleaner burn so the dpf filter is a little longer lasting the regens of the engines are a little longer between regens so the maintenance part of it is a is a pretty big deal for us we'd recommend diesel efficient to other fleets because it makes sense financially i mean that's the easiest thing to quantify it's a no-brainer all you have to do is put it in your fuel tank you don't have to add a trailer wing you don't have to add special tires you don't have to do anything you just put fuel in like you always did and there's a savings of a little over two percent it's a slam dunk [Music] you

ExxonMobil is transferring some of its Mobil Delvac™ oils over into the MobilGard™ family for its marine customers ahead of likely reformulations that will help ensure vessel operators remain compliant with evolving maritime regulations and operational requirements. 
  
 

  Stay tuned to hear more in the coming weeks! In the meantime, to find out how ExxonMobil can help your operations, visit: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/marine-industry/sectors/inland-and-coastal
title: It’s time to make the move to MobilGard™
content:
ExxonMobil is transferring some of its Mobil Delvac™ oils over into the MobilGard™ family for its marine customers ahead of likely reformulations that will help ensure vessel operators remain compliant with evolving maritime regulations and operational requirements. 

Stay tuned to hear more in the coming weeks! In the meantime, to find out how ExxonMobil can help your operations, visit: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/marine-industry/sectors/inland-and-coastal
bio:
Evolving environmental legislation and increased financial pressures have created many challenges for the marine industry. ExxonMobil Marine Fuels & Lubricants are committed to assisting vessel owners and operators overcome these challenges through our high quality range of products, services and expertise, across all sectors.

post_body_text:
Meeting the IMO’s ambitions to reduce carbon intensity of international shipping by at least 40% by 2030, moving to 70% by 2050 will require the development of new lower-emissions fuels (LEF). 
  
 

  Paving the LEF path is not an easy task. It requires collective cross-sector collaboration and effort from all stakeholders to ensure that the maritime industry addresses the scale of these goals. 
  
 

  Where do we go from here? Industry leaders from ExxonMobil, Lloyd’s Register, MAN ES, Whitaker Tankers and SeaRiver Maritime discuss the challenges of emission reduction, future fuels options and how legislation will play a key role. 
  
 

  Chapters:
  Outlining the challenges of GHG reduction [00:26-06:17]
  Future Fuel Options [06:17-11:35]
  Legislation is key [11:35-17:54]
  Supply and port infrastructure [17:54-20:37]
  Mitigating risk with new fuels [20:37-25:06]
  
 

  To read the latest from ExxonMobil on sustainability within shipping, click here: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/our-business/sustainability
title: Planning for a lower emission future – Part One
content:
Meeting the IMO’s ambitions to reduce carbon intensity of international shipping by at least 40% by 2030, moving to 70% by 2050 will require the development of new lower-emissions fuels (LEF). 

Paving the LEF path is not an easy task. It requires collective cross-sector collaboration and effort from all stakeholders to ensure that the maritime industry addresses the scale of these goals. 

Where do we go from here? Industry leaders from ExxonMobil, Lloyd’s Register, MAN ES, Whitaker Tankers and SeaRiver Maritime discuss the challenges of emission reduction, future fuels options and how legislation will play a key role. 

Chapters:
Outlining the challenges of GHG reduction [00:26-06:17]
Future Fuel Options [06:17-11:35]
Legislation is key [11:35-17:54]
Supply and port infrastructure [17:54-20:37]
Mitigating risk with new fuels [20:37-25:06]

To read the latest from ExxonMobil on sustainability within shipping, click here: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/our-business/sustainability
bio:
Evolving environmental legislation and increased financial pressures have created many challenges for the marine industry. post_body_text: How did we spend 2022? Providing a reliable supply of energy while we continue to lower emissions. We started the year by announcing our ambition to achieve net-zero Scope 1 and 2 emissions from our operated assets by 2050. We ended it by successfully starting one of the largest advanced recycling facilities in North America. What all did we do in between? Swipe or read the links below. To read more: Net-zero ambition announced for our operated assets by 2050 for scope 1 and 2: https://exxonmobil.co/3BUvhxb Carbon capture and storage expansion funded at LaBarge, Wyoming: https://exxonmobil.co/3VmDmBw Plans to build hydrogen and carbon capture and storage projects announced at Baytown, Texas https://exxonmobil.co/3ViisU8 Top certification for methane emissions management for natural gas awarded in the Permian Basin: https://exxonmobil.co/3FLT9UR 1st cargo of certified sustainable #aviation fuel delivered to Singapore Changi Airport: https://exxonmobil.co/3WomiMT Landmark commercial agreement to transport and store CO₂ emissions signed in Louisiana: https://exxonmobil.co/3WyLVu8 Increased production in Guyana to help meet demand: https://bit.ly/3jpGlM9 Large-scale advanced recycling unit started, can now process >80M lbs. of plastic waste per year: https://exxonmobil.co/3VktHeX #netzero #carboncapture #hydrogen #methane #ccs #louisiana #energy #energysupply #advancedrecycling

transcript_text:
[Music] [Music] Exxon Mobil and WEICan are working together to 
develop new technology and lubricants that's   going to help improve the wind industry. WEICAN
began as the Atlantic wind test site back in   1981 we're involved in wind energy research 
we also toy around with some solar projects   energy storage as well. These partnerships if 
you step back they're all about innovation   and the way Innovation happens is when you bring 
different people together with different skill   sets and it's that intersection of different 
areas of expertise that allows you to discover   things faster. Some of the things we're looking at 
are improving the lifetime of the lubricant used   in the wind turbine looking at reducing wear of 
components you might see in the wind turbines one   of the other things we're looking at is being able 
to operate the wind turbines non-stop.  Partnerships are really important to WEICan because we're so 
small we don't have the expertise to carry out   this research on our own. Exxon Mobil has some 
very specialized expertise that we don't have. Exxon Mobil Works in a lot of areas involving 
lubricants we're involved in lubricants for you   know jet airplanes you know ships a lot of folks 
are probably familiar with mobile one being used   for your cars and trucks. We've got innovation in 
terms of our understanding of lubricants WEICan   on the other hand has this great understanding of 
the industry, academia, what government policies and   regulations are doing, and it's the combination of 
the those areas of expertise coming together that   can enable us to make advances even faster. As 
wind becomes a bigger part of our grid we need   to be more reliable so operating longer and more 
frequently is important. I think one of the most   exciting thing about this partnership is be able 
to get out and actually see your lubricants in use   and being able you know climb up a wind turbine 
and actually see the parts being lubricated   and the power being generated I think is one of 
the most exciting things about this partnership

post_body_text: ✅ At least 2,700 feet to 4,000 feet underground. ✅ A three-tier system of technologies to monitor sites for leaks. ✅ Far enough away from fault lines and earthquake-prone areas. These are some of the factors Dr. Ganesh Dasari considers when selecting suitable storage sites for CO2. He’s leading the team designing some of the infrastructure for our #carboncapture and storage (CCS) opportunities near Houston and is key to evaluating safe and permanent CO2 storage sites. Learn more about the process ⤵️ https://exxonmobil.co/3j87C6k

post_body_text: 🔨🏗️ Construction moves forward on the largest renewable diesel facility in Canada. The Strathcona facility received a $560M investment from our majority-owned affiliate Imperial Oil today. With expected start-up in 2025, the Strathcona facility will: 🛢️ Produce up to 20K barrels of renewable diesel a day primarily from locally sourced feedstocks ⚡ Use low-carbon hydrogen with #carboncapture and storage technology 👷 ~600 direct construction jobs, along with hundreds more by business partners “The Strathcona project is another example of how we are investing in advantaged facilities and applying our leading technology and decades of experience to develop lower-emission solutions for customers,” said Karen McKee, president of ExxonMobil Product Solutions. “We continue to focus investments on markets like Canada, where well-designed policies support technologies that reduce life cycle emissions.” The facility is a part of our plans through 2027 to invest ~$17 billion in lower-emission initiatives. Read more: https://exxonmobil.co/3XH4JIG

More miles, fewer emissions? Discover the lower-emission fuel alternatives ExxonMobil is working on to help power the future of transportation.

post_body_text: Heavy industry, like manufacturing, steel, cement and power generation, has historically come with heavy emissions. But we're working to change that. 🏗️ 🏭 We're awarding another contract for our future #hydrogen facility in Baytown, TX. Because hydrogen is an affordable and reliable source of energy that can power our operations and our customers’ businesses from heavy-duty trucking to steel manufacturing. A hydrogen powered future is good for heavy industry and good for lower-emissions. ⚡️ In Baytown, we’re not just producing #hydrogen. We plan to capture 98% of our own CO2 emissions through carbon capture and storage (#CCS). This makes Baytown the largest low-carbon hydrogen project in the world at planned startup. Read more: https://exxonmobil.co/3XPtpyv

post_body_text: 📢FY 2022 #XOM earnings were released this morning. Our employees’ hard work enabled us to deliver industry-leading operating and financial results and shareholder returns in 2022. While our results clearly benefited from a favorable market, the counter-cyclical investments we made before and during the pandemic provided the energy and products people needed as economies began recovering and supplies became tight. We leaned in when others leaned out. Our plan for 2023 calls for further progress on our strategic objectives, which include leading the industry in safety, operating, and financial performance. We will continue to invest in our advantaged projects to deliver profitable growth, help meet society’s needs, and reduce emissions in our operations, while providing innovative solutions that help others reduce theirs. Read the full breakdown here: https://exxonmobil.co/3Jy6Qds

post_body_text:
Meeting the IMO’s ambitions to reduce carbon intensity of international shipping by at least 40% by 2030, moving to 70% by 2050 will require the development of new lower-emissions fuels (LEF). 
  
 

  Paving the LEF path is not an easy task. It requires collective cross-sector collaboration and effort from all stakeholders to ensure that the maritime industry addresses the scale of these goals. 
  
 

  Where do we go from here? Industry leaders from ExxonMobil, Lloyd’s Register, MAN ES, Whitaker Tankers and SeaRiver Maritime discuss the challenges of emission reduction, future fuels options and how legislation will play a key role. 
  
 

  Chapters:
  Outlining the challenges of GHG reduction [00:26-06:22]
  Future Fuel Options [06:22-11:23]
  Legislation is key [11:23-17:41]
  Supply and port infrastructure [17:41-20:25]
  Mitigating risk with new fuels [20:25-24:35]
  
 

  To read the latest from ExxonMobil on sustainability within shipping, click here: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/our-business/sustainability
title: Planning for a lower emission future – Part One
content:
Meeting the IMO’s ambitions to reduce carbon intensity of international shipping by at least 40% by 2030, moving to 70% by 2050 will require the development of new lower-emissions fuels (LEF). 

Paving the LEF path is not an easy task. It requires collective cross-sector collaboration and effort from all stakeholders to ensure that the maritime industry addresses the scale of these goals. 

Where do we go from here? Industry leaders from ExxonMobil, Lloyd’s Register, MAN ES, Whitaker Tankers and SeaRiver Maritime discuss the challenges of emission reduction, future fuels options and how legislation will play a key role. 

Chapters:
Outlining the challenges of GHG reduction [00:26-06:22]
Future Fuel Options [06:22-11:23]
Legislation is key [11:23-17:41]
Supply and port infrastructure [17:41-20:25]
Mitigating risk with new fuels [20:25-24:35]

To read the latest from ExxonMobil on sustainability within shipping, click here: https://www.exxonmobil.com/en/marine/our-business/sustainability
bio:
Evolving environmental legislation and increased financial pressures have created many challenges for the marine industry. ExxonMobil Marine Fuels & Lubricants are committed to assisting vessel owners and operators overcome these challenges through our high quality range of products, services and expertise, across all sectors.


Subscribe now to be kept up to date with all of our latest video content.

ExxonMobil
Energy lives here™

bio: ExxonMobil Chemical is one of the largest chemical companies worldwide. Our mission is to provide quality chemical products and services in the most efficient and responsible manner to generate outstanding customer and shareholder value while remaining committed to the principles of sustainable development.

post_body_text: ⚡️ Working to produce energy and products to meet people’s needs and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Our Chairman and CEO, Darren Woods, shared with Dan Yergin today at CERAWeek by IHS Markit how we’re working to produce critical energy and products to meet society’s evolving needs while reducing greenhouse gas emissions. “We have set a target of net zero in the Permian by 2030. And one of the points of doing that was to demonstrate to the world we can do both. The Permian is one of our fastest-growing production operations, and we’re reducing emissions. Just this year, we’ve reached zero routine flaring and we’re on track to get a net-zero position in the Permian by 2030 while we grow production to 1 million barrels per day.” We view success as working to solve the “and” equation, one in which we can produce the energy and products society needs – and – be a leader in reducing our own greenhouse gas emissions and those from others. Learn how reliable, secure energy supply can be maintained even as we all work to help the world progress to a lower-emission energy future. ☞ https://exxonmobil.co/3yjyios

post_body_text: Effective servicing of wind turbine equipment is important to help reduce downtime and maintenance costs, and reduce the potential for repairs. In this video, you will see how effective and efficient cleaning of the entire mechanism matters and why ExxonMobil Actrel™ fluids with excellent solubility and low surface tension has the advanced cleaning power and wetting capabilities required that help to effectively remove old and hardening grease, while potentially improve wind power generation. Learn more: https://www.exxonmobilchemical.com/en/resources/library/library-detail/106457/asset?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=fluids_energy&utm_content=106457

introducing actual cleaning agent actrel is the latest generation fluid especially designed to help rejuvenate bearings and other Machinery parts during maintenance besides high efficiency cleaning Acro can help to protect turbine parts thanks to the low to no impact it can have on ceiling elastomers and metal Parts actrol can also secure the comfort and safety of Maintenance staff as it is virtual yodelus has an occupational exposure level of 1200 milligrams per square meter offers low Hazard inhalation toxicity and ambient to normal handling temperatures in addition actual fluids are post_body_text: Tackling climate change will take all of us. That was the main point our CEO, Darren Woods, shared with the Harvard Business School Club of Houston today. We’re one of the few companies with the scale and expertise to help society progress toward its net-zero goals. We take this responsibility seriously. Because about 80% of global energy-related CO₂ emissions come from heavy industry, electricity generation and commercial transportation, we’re focused on bringing solutions like carbon capture and storage, hydrogen and lower-emission fuels to "hard to decarbonize" sectors. As we apply our unique strengths to support a low-carbon future, we’re also building a compelling new business. And we believe the market for emissions reductions to achieve society’s net-zero goals could reach $14 trillion by 2050. Learn more about our Low Carbon Solutions business here: https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions?sf176445755=1#TechnologyIndustrialscalesolutions

ExxonMobil and the Wind Energy Institute of Canada are working together to develop the next generation of wind lubricants. See how technicians monitor the turbines and service them with oil 260 feet above the ground.
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Learn more about how the Wind Energy Institute of Canada and ExxonMobil are developing the next generation of wind lubricants. transcript_text:
My daily activities include climbing wind turbines,
troubleshooting wind turbines, servicing wind   turbines, maintaining them, and also helping with a 
little bit of the data analytics that goes on here   in the lab. In a wind turbine the most important 
component being lubricated is the gearbox. Here   at WEICan the tower is equipped with an elevator 
which gets you about three quarters of the way so   the last quarter takes me about a minute and 
15 seconds to climb. [Music] When you do climb large wind turbine you're climbing mostly on 
the inside of the Tower so you don't really   get the perspective on how high you actually are 
until you climb outside the nacelle and then when   you start seeing the tree line below you and 
you realize that you can see miles and miles   out in the horizon it's quite shocking and quite 
exciting at the same time. [Music]

post_body_text: We’ve teamed up with Toyota USA to test innovative fuels with the potential to significantly reduce GHG emissions from road transportation compared to today’s conventional fuels. The test fuels are compatible with: 🚗 Current and older vehicles ⛽ Existing fueling infrastructure It’s an exciting result that shows the potential for these fuels to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from road transportation. As Andrew Madden said, reaching that potential will require supportive and effective policies for fuels, vehicles and fueling infrastructure. Such policies can help drive rapid greenhouse emission reductions by fostering innovation and competition across all technologies that produce cost-effective solutions for consumers. Our engineers created these innovative fuels, incorporating lower-emission components made from renewable sources such as wastes, residues or co-products. Read the Automotive News link or see our site to learn more. https://bit.ly/3KPsV6x https://exxonmobil.co/3A6wEre

ExxonMobil’s latest sustainability report summarizes ExxonMobil’s sustainability focus areas and how ExxonMobil aims to help protect people, the environment and the communities where we operate. Our focus areas include environmental topics – air, water, climate, and biodiversity – as well as safety and potential impacts to, and opportunities for, people and communities. The report also highlights some examples of our work around the world.
  
 

  Read the full report here: https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/-/media/global/files/sustainability-report/publication/exxonmobil-sustainability-report.pdf
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  See how ExxonMobil is working to enhance local workforce development in Guyana, promote biodiversity and economic growth in Papua New Guinea, manage water resources and reduce GHG emissions in the Permian Basin in the U.S. 
  
 

  Watch to learn more about our efforts to help meet energy demand while integrating sustainability into what we do.

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil and Nucor Corporation have agreed to work on a new carbon capture and storage project that will capture, transport, and store up to 800,000 metric tons per year of CO2 from Nucor’s manufacturing site in Convent, Louisiana.
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Learn how ExxonMobil's Low Carbon Solutions business and Nucor Corporation, North America's largest steel producers, will be working to help industrial customers reduce emissions by transporting and storing CO2. 
  
 

  See how the Nucor project, expected to start up in 2026, will support Louisiana’s objective of reaching net-zero CO2 emissions by 2050. It will also mark a milestone for ExxonMobil as it will bring the total CO2 we’ve agreed to transport and store for third-party customers to 5 million metric tons per year (MTA). 
  
 

  Learn more about how we are delivering industrial solutions to reduce emissions:
  https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions
  
 

  Explore our carbon capture and storage technology:
  https://lowcarbon.exxonmobil.com/lower-carbon-technology/carbon-capture-and-storage
  
 

  Discover how we are continuing to support a net-zero future:
  https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/news/reporting-and-publications/advancing-climate-solutions-progress-report
  
 

  Follow ExxonMobil for the latest updates on advancing climate solutions:
  LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil/ 
  Twitter: https://twitter.com/exxonmobil 
  Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/exxonmobil/ 
  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ExxonMobil/
title: Carbon capture and storage with Nucor | ExxonMobil
content:
ExxonMobil and Nucor Corporation have agreed to work on a new carbon capture and storage project that will capture, transport, and store up to 800,000 metric tons per year of CO2 from Nucor’s manufacturing site in Convent, Louisiana.

Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1

Learn how ExxonMobil's Low Carbon Solutions business and Nucor Corporation, North America's largest steel producers, will be working to help industrial customers reduce emissions by transporting and storing CO2. 

See how the Nucor project, expected to start up in 2026, will support Louisiana’s objective of reaching net-zero CO2 emissions by 2050. It will also mark a milestone for ExxonMobil as it will bring the total CO2 we’ve agreed to transport and store for third-party customers to 5 million metric tons per year (MTA). 

Learn more about how we are delivering industrial solutions to reduce emissions:
https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions

Explore our carbon capture and storage technology:
https://lowcarbon.exxonmobil.com/lower-carbon-technology/carbon-capture-and-storage

Discover how we are continuing to support a net-zero future:
https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/news/reporting-and-publications/advancing-climate-solutions-progress-report

Follow ExxonMobil for the latest updates on advancing climate solutions:
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil/ 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/exxonmobil 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/exxonmobil/ 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ExxonMobil/
bio:
The need for energy is universal. That's why ExxonMobil scientists and engineers are pioneering new research and pursuing new technologies to reduce emissions while creating more efficient fuels. 

We're committed to responsibly meeting the world's energy needs.

We aim to achieve #netzero emissions from our operated assets by 2050 (for Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions) and are taking a comprehensive approach to create emission-reduction roadmaps for major operated assets. 
 
▶️Subscribe for the latest in lower-emission technologies and advancements. 
 
Find us also on:
Linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil
Twitter.com/ExxonMobil
Facebook.com/ExxonMobil
Instagram.com/ExxonMobil
YouTube.com/ExxonMobil
ExxonMobil.com 

Find our latest Privacy Policy at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/Global-legal-pages/privacy-policy

See our terms and conditions, including corporate separateness, at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/global-legal-pages/terms-and-conditions

экономит на еде самцы и международные изоляция за войну в Украине дыра в Российской бюджете растет рекордными танками и экономические ограничения Когда будет нанесен решающий сокрушительный удар русских [музыка] [музыка] Россия одна из самых богатых ресурсами стран мира которая активно разрабатывала свои недра и сколотила состояние на продаже газа нефти угля алмазов но после 24 февраля 2022 года санкционное давление усилилось настолько что нанесло экономики РФ сокрушительный удар последняя десятилетие Кремль планомерно превращал Россию в государство бензоколонку и даже посадил Европу на газовый крючок торговля топливом приносила гигантские Суммы до 120 млрд долларов в год только тратились они не на улучшение благосостояния граждан значительная часть денег фактически шла подготовку к аннексии чужих территорий и полномасштабной после 24 февраля 2022 года цивилизованный мир и амбарго на российское топливо сумел перекрыть поток нефтедолларов стране агрессору врезультате Раф лишилась основного источника пополнения своей госкостной колоссальные потери вследствие ведения потолка цен на нефть и эмбарго на российские нефтепродукты доставляемые морским транспортом А это почти 90 процентов всех поставок так только сначала февраля ежедневная потеря России на уровне 280 миллионов долларов Они получают на руки на руки конкретно на свои счета намного меньше денег чем раньше это важно потому что это новые деньги это ликвидность ликвидные деньги которые не могут использовать для покрытия проблем В бюджете и для финансирования газом ситуации ещё хуже прибыль в феврале этого года упала на 42 процента по сравнению с 2022 в начале войны нам разговорили все что Европе нужно 7 лет для того чтобы избавиться от зависимости от российского газа на самом деле 7 месяцев Для этого хватило это фантастические изменения это трансформация в прошлом году это болезненно потому что в прошлом году Мы помним какие цены были на ГАЗ там 3000 долларов за тысячу кубометров сегодня это 300 400 долларов и все поняли что это был Блеф и пшик это невозможность жизни без российских ресурсов которые получают страна именно от продажи нефтепродуктов и газов доходы сократились А вот война никуда не делась как и растущие расходы на неё Путин тратит на так называемую специальную операцию около трети доходов а скудневшего бюджета страны как результат в казне огромная дыра уже в мае дефицит бюджета достиг 3.5 триллионов рублей а то больше чем российский Минфин планировал на весь 2023 год 20 бюджетом катастрофическая когда хочется жировая прослойка начнётся невыплата зарплат начнутся его не выплаты социальных э всяких гарантий несоблюдение всех социальных гарантий и так далее и так далее последствия санкции для нефтегазовой отрасли России будут ещё тяжелее международном валютном фонде прогнозируют падение экономики РФ на 7%, сегодня срочная перспективе ситуация уже вышла из-под контроля и Путина об этом предупреждают к нему люди с правительства знал когда-то очень хорошо храм люди к нему люди идут и говорят товарищ если такая будет продолжаться мы банкроты к лету Вот только хозяин Кремля этого и слышать не хочет это стиль Путина то что там один институт государственной власти это Диктатор Путин У него горизонт планирования очень маленький вот день прожить до ночи продержаться поэтому я думаю никто не думает на 3-4 месяца А вот президенту РФ всё нипочем уверяет партнеров по евразийскому экономическому Союзу Что потрясение ждать не стоит не произошло увеличить объем Это очень хороший показатель Вот только на самом деле россияне стали тратить меньше это признают даже социологи из придворного Кремлю Всероссийского центра изучения общественного мнения Каждый третий житель РФ вынужден экономить на еде и даже по официальным данным росстата доходы россиян в прошлом году росли медленнее чем цены то есть люди стали беднее но Даже эти официальные данные очень приукрашены говорят экономисты особенно показатель инфляции 12% которые рисуют официальная статистика совсем не то что россияне видят на ценниках но только не для властей и пропагандистов в обществе с экранов побеждать стабильности русских действительно все хорошо цены на продукты абсолютно нормальные В общем санкции не работают часть россиян продолжают верить телевизору а не собственным глазами кошелькам ничего такого особо не потеряли даже если что-то потеряли Ничего страшного у нас замещение все-таки есть Ну и таких людей в России с каждым днем все меньше даже у самых Патриотов и ватников они понимают насколько это на их собственной жизни сказалось как-то ударила по кошельку по карману что Цены только растут значительно побывал в нескольких российских городах ростов-на-дону Воронеж Москву санкт-петербург через прибалтику добрался до Киева рассказывает цены в российских магазинах выше чем в Украине Несмотря на то что на ее территории продолжаются война войска РФ бьют и по зернохранилищам и по продуктовым складам сотни гектаров украинских полей не засеяны из-за близости к фронту и замин и не разорвавшихся боеприпасов для сравнения смотрим цены на сайте одной из российских торговых сетей картофель открываем смотрим цена 63 руб То есть около 30 гривен и видим здесь что 20 гривен примерно на треть картошка будет дешевле в Украине в России за последний год стремительно взлетели цены именно на самое необходимое мясо молочные продукты крупы ещё недавно она жила в Москве училась в университете зарплаты не растут стипендии растёт а цены Да ты уже не можешь там кушать например мясо каждый день тебе нужно кушать Мясо раз в три дня вы говорите образно или это ваш Опыт мой опыт экономить приходилось на всём макароны допустим они стали очень дорогие меня мама прям самый самый дешевые продукты покупают после полномасштабного вторжения в Украину из России ушли крупные международные бренды в магазинах которые еще работают сами взлетели в разы было купить за 2000 рублей сейчас ты их покупаешь за 10.000 руб Сейчас нет дисконтов но хуже всего с лекарствами по данным частного российского исследовательского центра Рамир за последний год они подорожали почти на 30 процентов А в государственном ростате утверждают цены на медпрепараты поднялись всего на 10 процентов это неправда рассказывает жительница Москвы не на Нестерова на некоторое лекарство цены взлетели в разы а некоторых вообще не найти пропали многие лекарства и вот это плохо это лекарство которое нужно принимать длительно и их Нельзя бросать вообще и резко тем более исчезли из аптек препараты для диабетиков и онкобольных и даже с поставками импортных антибиотиков и жаропонижающих [музыка] такие указания были мы этим гадом покажем Сами будем производить Вот только самим производить не получается ведь фармацевтические заводы в России работают на импортном сырье чиновники от Минздрава понимают это но Путин Видимо нет боятся к нему подойти что все наша индустрия фармацевтическая но на грани банкротства и поэтому надо переходить на Западное Западное во-первых 2-3 раза дороже стали в России практически все импортные товары ведь в РФ обвалился курс рубля сначала этого года упал по отношению к доллару на 16 процентов и вошел в тройку наиболее обесценившихся валют в мире глава Центробанка нам рынке сейчас наше видение предполагает постепенное нарастание инфляционного давления до конца года чтобы сбережения сохраняли свою покупательную способность с течением времени Их можно разместить на банковском депозите проценты которые банки предлагают например сегодня это 6-7 процентов которые получит вкладчик через некоторое время когда закончится они будут покрывать общие рост цен Вот только банком доверяют все меньше россиян особенно после санкций и ареста 3050 миллиардов долларов резервов Центробанка и запрета США ввозить на Личный доллар в РФ как результат некоторые удовольствие для россиян уже стали недоступными из-за цены из-за политики властей которая приводит к тотальному подорожанию всего что можно было купить к примеру в РФ запретили возить автомобили из Европы и запчасти В итоге даже стоимость подержанных авто за год взлетела на 37 процентов некоторые мои знакомые просто с первого чтения с первых же дней войны они продали свой этот марки автопром немецкий европейские цены на запчасти сразу подскочили этого там чуть ли не четверть стоимости машины Может тебе обойтись какая-то там небольшая деталь не поломка там не знаю коробка передач например какая-нибудь Элементарная та же ситуация и самолётами российских авиалиний летать на них стало попросту опасно поломки случаются всё чаще ведь после введения санкций против авиации в РФ не поставляют запчасти и комплектующие и не обслуживают её самолёты ну обычным россиянам недолётов туристические услуги и отдых в России за последние год подорожали на 15%, а денег многие уже не хватает даже на то чтобы оригинальные услуги оплатить тарифы на них повысились на 15 процентов чуть ли не единственное что дешевеет в России Это водка власть пытается сделать так чтобы народ был одурманен алкоголем А еще пропагандой телевизор изо всех сил пытается победить стремительно опустеющий холодильник А чтобы люди не задавали лишних вопросов правительство выдало вот такое распоряжение приказала за секретить ключевые экономические показатели это Явный признак того что ситуация в экономике очень тяжелая и власть Всеми силами пытается это скрыть россиянам и прячут правду и прячут правду и от региона например прячут правду и конечно пытаются Вот это они пытаются в России создавать эту Пропаганду что на них санкции не действуют информация которая подается населению она подчищается подают информацию в очень урезанном и не совсем правдивым виде но правда которую пытаются скрыть в официальной статистике становится все заметнее в реальной жизни меньше затрат на медицину меньше затрат на образование меньше затрат на инвестиционные программы по другим социальным направлениям Кремль пытается скрыть от россиян и то в каком состоянии их фонд национального благосостояния Раньше он наполнялся за счет дохода от газа и нефти и деньги из него шли на социальные выплаты Теперь когда доходы сократились не просто не наполняется и Райт из него деньги причём много и если нынешние танцы сохранятся уже до конца года в нём не останется ничего а ведь фон национального благосостояния ещё называют золотом пенсионеров одна из его функций софинансирование добровольных пенсионных накоплений граждан Вот только это золото Кремль начал активно продавать в январе например из фонда вывели 3,5 тонны этого драгоценного металла продают из фонда и валюту чтобы закрыть дыру в бюджете А уже из госказны огромная часть вырученных средств идёт на финансирование так называемой спецоперации таким образом фон национального благосостояния окончательно перестаёт быть золотом пенсионеров и становится кошельком из которого финансируется никакого золота ничего пенсионерам армию денег нету на армию нужно тратить очень хочется воевать Ну вот тут туда пойдут деньги пенсионер я-то еще одна причина почему данная расходах бюджета засекречивают Ведь все больше денег идет на войну по оценкам издания Forbes Кремль каждый месяц выделяет на это до 10 миллиардов долларов санкции делают цену войны для Москвы всё более высокой это и есть их главная цель но Путин эту цену с готовностью платит при этом уменьшая расходы на нужды обычных людей на индексацию пенсии на медицину и образование всё это оказалось на голодном пайке международный эксперты уже прогнозируют уровень жизни россиян будет падать намного быстрее чем это было на протяжении прошлого года Посмотрите на Северную Корею посмотрите Посмотрите на Кубу вот Куда движется Россия она движется к невероятной бедности ограничения которые ввели против России работают а все заявления представитель путинского режима о том что санкционные планы Запада не оправдались являются ложными если долго держать санкции и делать их все сильнее и сильнее они работают ключевые наиболее сокрушительные ограничения органа нефти нефтепродукты вступили в силу Прошлой зимой и в начале этого года Так что по-настоящему разрушительное влияние санкций начинается только сейчас ведь весь прошлый год в мире держались высокие цены на нефть и газ что позволяло Кремлю получать прибыли и создавать хоть какую-то иллюзию стабильности больше такой возможности не будет диски полностью потерял рынок Европейского Союза который раньше приносил больше всего прибыли и которому очень удобно и выгодно было качать энергоресурсы по разветвленным трубопроводам Теперь же Россия вынуждена поставлять свою нефть и нефтепродукты Китаю Индии в африканские страны и даже в латинскую Америку танкеры плывут за тысячи километров чтобы сбыть эту нефть с огромной скидкой Золотые времена изобилия нефтедолларов для Путина закончились новая покупатели уже не такие богатые и не такие сговорчивые то есть какие-то маргиналы которые готовы использовать какой-то мутный черный флот обходить подкладывать документы выключать транспондеры на танкерах чтобы их не было видно вот это удел сегодня России искать теперь на другом конце планеты своих покупателей продавать им за дешево То есть просто для них вся экономика перевернулась для них это потеря они ещё сами Я думаю не поняли что они потеряли самый большой парадокс в том что добыча нефти в России увеличивается Ара в качает всё больше и больше чтобы за счет количества компенсировать катастрофическое для Кремля падение Цен если в прошлом году он продавал нефть по цене выше чем 100 долларов за Баррель то сейчас менее чем по 60 по цене там общество штаты с санкциями нависают Европа вообще не зайдешь страховку не получишь поэтому Ну давай Вот давай подешевле нефть продают уже дешевле чем ее себестоимость на скважинах их не консервируют Лишь потому что раз консервировать снова фактически невозможно есть команда держаться любой ценой быть на плаву идти на убытки но не сокращать добычу нефти и вот люди которые Ну жили Как бога за пазуха это нефтяники газовики скоро будут очень сильные А на некоторых этих предприятиях Да держались посёлке бункеры заходят в российские порты выключают навигационные системы затем плывут в Средиземное море и там прямо на воде переливают нефть в другие танкеры чтобы замести следы но все это видно на спутнике спрятать танкер это не иголка в стоге сена То есть ты все-таки можешь отследить где он был и таким образом установить имело дело с этим токсичным ресурсом или нет законных доходов страны большой Семёрки готовят очередной 11 пакет санкций одна из его целей устранить схема обхода принятых ранее ограничений есть еще по одной прибыльной для России сфере торговля алмазами ежегодно она приносила несколько миллиардов долларов сейчас мы сфокусированы на закрытии возможности в азеек и продолжим отрезать Россию от критических поставок мы ограничим торговлю российскими алмазами российские алмазы не вечны под санкции попадут и российские медь алюминий и Никель перекроют и возможность России покупать необходимое ей оборудование в обход санкций сейчас это делают с помощью третьих стран в 10 раз нарастил покупку компьютерной техники достаточно много компаний которые покупают компьютерную технику переправляют в Российской Федерации наступает и оборудование для производства оружия и военной техники но в мире всё это видят США добавили в черный список 71 компанию за поддержку России это же делает их Европейский Союз в 11 пакете санкций у нас более 90 компаний по всему миру в отношении которых мы имеем четкие доказательства того что они нарушают санкции то есть поставляют санкционные товары непосредственно в Россию из Европейского Союза В обход через третий страны Урсула фон дер ляйн глава еврокомиссии а значит иллюзия что санкции не работают и что их можно обойти скоро окончательно развеяться Россия на сегодня страна против которой введено рекордное количество ограничений их уже более 14 тысяч больше чем против Северной Кореи и Ирана вместе взятых теперь страны большой семерки нацелены добиваться исполнения и результата от уже введенных против воров санкций и саммит в Японии показало политическая Воля для этого есть без политической воли не было бы ничего то есть на сегодняшний момент Европа едина как никогда в этом вопросе доводить эту ситуацию российской экономики обычных россиян не является целью санкций стремительное падение уровня жизни граждан это результат исключительно политики Кремля причина всех неприятностей которые происходят с Россией сегодня конечно это лично Путин Ну и его окружение которое он вовлек во все преступную войну Это очевидно совершенно но это не очевидно для подавляющего большинства глубинного народа Потому что есть Пропаганда Потому что есть промывание мозгов это промывание мозгов на протяжении последних 23 лет ведётся крайне интенсивно Парадокс но пока санкции больно бьют по экономике РФ и обычным гражданам приближённая к Кремлю бизнесмена Наоборот богатеют за последние год в России стала на 22 млрдра больше почитала издание Forbes совокупное состояние всех российских миллиардеров тоже выросла смотреть и здесь всё объясняется принципом кому война а кому Мать родна это условно условный бизнес который обслуживает войну но это опять-таки сложно назвать бизнесом наверное обогатились крупные бизнесмены которая курировали обход санкций миллиардеры которые в частности работают на торговле внутренней То есть это возможность через этих миллиардеро…

post_body_text:
At Esso, we know summer is all about exploring new places, heading to festivals and gigs, and enjoying sporting events in the sun. 
  
 

  We also know that how you get there is something to think about, so we've teamed up with Liftshare to encourage people to buddy up to share journeys. It's a great way to meet like-minded people going your way, take fewer car journeys, save some cash and even help to reduce car emissions. 
  
 

  Check out what happened when cricket legend, Phil Tufnell, and comedy genius John Robins, picked up a Liftshare member heading to the same cricket match. 
  
 

  For more information on how sharing lifts makes epic trips, click on the link: http://www.esso.co.uk/share-a-lift
title: Ride With Tuffers: Phil Tufnell and John Robins share a ride to cricket - Esso x Liftshare
content:
At Esso, we know summer is all about exploring new places, heading to festivals and gigs, and enjoying sporting events in the sun. 

We also know that how you get there is something to think about, so we've teamed up with Liftshare to encourage people to buddy up to share journeys. It's a great way to meet like-minded people going your way, take fewer car journeys, save some cash and even help to reduce car emissions. 

Check out what happened when cricket legend, Phil Tufnell, and comedy genius John Robins, picked up a Liftshare member heading to the same cricket match. 

For more information on how sharing lifts makes epic trips, click on the link: http://www.esso.co.uk/share-a-lift
bio:
Discover Esso fuels on YouTube. 
Subscribe to learn more about the Esso fuels brand, our services and initiatives, including how you can benefit when you fill up your tank at Esso service station across the world. 

Esso is proud to be one of the leading fuel retailers, serving customers 365 days a year. 
www.esso.com

Follow us on social media:
GB: facebook.com/EssoGB | www.twitter.com/Esso_GB
Belgium: facebook.com/EssoBelgium | twitter.com/Esso_BE
Netherlands: facebook.com/EssoNederland | twitter.com/Esso_NL
Germany: facebook.com/EssoDeutschland | twitter.com/Esso_DE
Italy: facebook.com/EssoITA | twitter.com/Esso_IT

people and chat to them in the car. So, how about A to Z cricketers? Oh, okay. I'll start things off with, Alec Stewart. Oh okay, it's first names is it? Yeah. Do I go next? Yeah, you go next. Bob Willis Bob Willis, so C. Oh man, I hate quizzes. So Dave, what have you always wanted to ask Phil Tufnell? Because he can't go anywhere now. What was it like playing for England? Well, I mean, it was a huge honour. To represent your country is a great feeling and it doesn't go away from you. That first moment, it's sort of still the same your twentieth time as well. Uhh, F. There's a double here Frank Frank Hayes Freddie Flintoff. Ah you could’ve had a double. Ah I could have. Ohhhh. I’ll have a double. Graham Gooch. What would you say Tuffers has been the biggest difference between the game now if you had to sort of pinpoint one thing between what the game is now and when you played? Fitness, strength and conditioning, diet. I mean, we were all pretty fit when we played but I mean, these guys now are you know, they are,  you know they are machines. Heather Knight. Ohhh Belter. What's after H? I. I. I was thinking I was running through the alphabet in my head. If you're struggling with the alphabet part of the game. I'm gonna go for, Paul Fairbrother. No, no, no, no, oh no I’m frozen out. Paul, no what’s his name? Neil Fairbrother, or Paul Farbrace. That's it. Yes. Neil Fairbrother, was my idol growing up as a young left hander.

bio:
The need for energy is universal. That's why ExxonMobil scientists and engineers are pioneering new research and pursuing new technologies to reduce emissions while creating more efficient fuels. 

We're committed to responsibly meeting the world's energy needs.

We aim to achieve #netzero emissions from our operated assets by 2050 (for Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions) and are taking a comprehensive approach to create emission-reduction roadmaps for major operated assets. 
 
▶️Subscribe for the latest in lower-emission technologies and advancements. 
 
Find us also on:
Linkedin.com/company/exxonmobil
Twitter.com/ExxonMobil
Facebook.com/ExxonMobil
Instagram.com/ExxonMobil
YouTube.com/ExxonMobil
ExxonMobil.com 

Find our latest Privacy Policy at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/Global-legal-pages/privacy-policy

See our terms and conditions, including corporate separateness, at https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/global-legal-pages/terms-and-conditions
transcript_text: If you were to make a list of the companies in the world that have a credible chance of actually bending the curve for the world's path to net zero, then I put ExxonMobil at the top of that list. Our customers are recognizing the knowledge and depth that we bring to the table. We know our customers are placing significant weight on our execution capability. They're wanting a partner they can count on to deliver. The chart shows the sources of the 33 billion metric tons of energy related CO2 emissions that the world generates today. And what's interesting here is the huge proportion of emissions that come from industrial sources, from power generation, and from commercial transportation. And together they account for 80 percent of all energy related emissions, and these are the hard to decarbonize sectors that we at ExxonMobil are most focused on. And that's where our capabilities come in. Our Low Carbon Solutions business is intensely focused on helping to accelerate the world's path to net zero by making that path economically viable and making it executable at a scale that matters. We offer a one-stop shop CCS solution from capture through transportation to storage and that will enable these customers  to reduce their emissions. We're getting underway with execution plans for building a world-scale, low-carbon, hydrogen plant. Our majority owned affiliate, Imperial Oil, announced final investment decision for a 20 kbd renewable diesel facility at the Strathcona refinery in Canada. We have tremendous advantage  built on our technology, our scale, our project execution, and our value chain integration. Momentum is definitely starting to build and it's going to be an exciting and high impact time ahead.

transcript_text: [Music] the old saying that oil and water don't mix is true sort of oil is hydroscopic it can absorb water in a process called emulsification but that molecular mix can be destructive oil degraded by water can lose its power to lubricate and transfer heat water in the oil can create bone and cause corrosion bad news for Machinery industrial operators dealing with humid or wet environments such as in steel and paper mills mining sites and wind farms need lubricants that provide good emulsibility demossibility is the measure of a lubricant's capacity to release water to separate from it to avoid losing the properties that protect equipment thanks to their highly uniform molecular structure synthetic-based stocks are known for having excellent emulsability compared to mineral-based stocks synthetics are better able to handle water contamination even in harsh conditions where water is a concern lubricants formulated with synthetic-based stocks can protect equipment longer a mix that's truly a match innovate confidently [Music]

transcript_text: [Music] owners and operators of heavy duty equipment are making this switch from conventional to synthetic lubricants the main reason optimized maintenance leading to improved productivity compared to Conventional based stocks synthetics help improve wear protection at high and low temperatures heavy duty engines can last longer and run more reliably optimizing maintenance costs and protecting the investment through enhanced oxidative and thermal stability synthetic base stocks enable longer oil life reducing the frequency of equipment downtime product replacement and oil disposal synthetics also offer potential for improved fuel economy and Energy Efficiency which can add up to significant savings especially across an entire fleet designed and manufactured to handle the increasing demands of modern heavy duty equipment synthetic-based stocks can help meet new oil specifications so it's no mystery why owners and operators are switching or why synthetic-based docks help formulators achieve increased levels of lubricant performance innovate confidently foreign

ExxonMobil is a sponsor and technical partner of Toyota Gazoo Racing (TGR), one of the top racing teams in the World Rally Championship. We provide TGR with bespoke lubricants that drive top-level performance, and we also get the unique opportunity to test formulations that inform our commercial products.
  
 

  Learn how ExxonMobil and TGR work together to win races and how lubricants are fundamental in and out of the circuit.
  
 

  Listen in as Jose Alberto Gomez, senior researcher at ExxonMobil, explains how his team used lubricants for Toyota Gazoo Racing, resulting in three championships wins in 2022.

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil’s latest technology, direct air capture is a technology that removes carbon dioxide molecules directly from the atmosphere. 
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Listen in as Lead Process Engineer Jesse McManus explains how negative emission technology, like direct air capture, can capture more co2 from the atmosphere than what it produces, essentially generating a credit that can be used to offset emissions from hardest to abate sectors.
  
 

  Learn more about carbon capture storage safety: https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions/carbon-capture-and-storage/carbon-capture-storage-safety

transcript_text: DAC is an essential technology for meeting society's net-zero emission goals and is complementary to other emission-reduction solutions. Switching to lower-emission energy sources gets us most of the way there, but even fuel switching and the leading abatement technologies can't mitigate emissions completely. This leaves a significant amount of emissions that still need to be managed. That's where negative-emission technology like DAC comes in. DAC captures more CO2 from the atmosphere than it produces, essentially generating a credit that can be used to offset the emissions. Carbon captured and sequestered by DAC is more easily measured and verified than other negative-emissions technologies, making DAC a good option for ensuring we can truly get to net zero.

post_body_text: In addition to the general assessment of the non-ionic surfactant properties, this work focuses its efforts on the wetting properties of these surfactants, relying on the use of a goniometer for contact angle measurements of surfactants solutions onto various substrates. Finally, Phase Inversion Temperature (PIT) of the surfactants solutions, obtained through rheological measurements, have been used to quickly and reliably generate Hydrophilic Lipophilic Deviation (HLD) characteristic curvatures of these surfactants. post_body_text:
"An ExxonMobil study on freezer films carried out across Europe showed that approximately 50% of the market consists of polyethylene coextruded (PE CoEx) multi-layer films and the other half of laminated films. Most of these laminated films are multi-material and as a result, can be a challenge to recycle. This video shows how brand owner Bonduelle addressed this challenge. A collaboration between ExxonMobil, Bonduelle and Constantia. Learn more: https://www.exxonmobilchemical.com/en/resources/library/library-detail/111438/bonduelle_case_study_landscape_v3?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=pe_agriculture&utm_content=111438
  
 

  *recyclable in communities where programs or facilities exist"
title: Creating high-performance, downgauged, recyclable*, non-laminated freezer film with brand appeal
content:
"An ExxonMobil study on freezer films carried out across Europe showed that approximately 50% of the market consists of polyethylene coextruded (PE CoEx) multi-layer films and the other half of laminated films. Most of these laminated films are multi-material and as a result, can be a challenge to recycle. This video shows how brand owner Bonduelle addressed this challenge. A collaboration between ExxonMobil, Bonduelle and Constantia. Learn more: https://www.exxonmobilchemical.com/en/resources/library/library-detail/111438/bonduelle_case_study_landscape_v3?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=pe_agriculture&utm_content=111438

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil is developing a sustainable solution that will help extract lithium 10,000 feet below Arkansas.
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Listen in to learn more about ExxonMobil’s new lithium extraction technology that is 66% less carbon-intensive than traditional rock mining. The direct lithium extraction process, which is considered a more environmentally responsible method, will require a small land footprint and can recycle over 90% of water back into a reservoir. By 2030, we aim to produce enough lithium to supply the manufacturing industry with about 1 million electric vehicles per year.

title: Extracting Lithium Below Arkansas | ExxonMobil
content:
ExxonMobil is developing a sustainable solution that will help extract lithium 10,000 feet below Arkansas.

Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1

Listen in to learn more about ExxonMobil’s new lithium extraction technology that is 66% less carbon-intensive than traditional rock mining. The direct lithium extraction process, which is considered a more environmentally responsible method, will require a small land footprint and can recycle over 90% of water back into a reservoir. By 2030, we aim to produce enough lithium to supply the manufacturing industry with about 1 million electric vehicles per year.  

Learn more about our lithium project in Arkansas:
https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions/lithium/faces-and-places-our-arkansas-lithium-project

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil’s latest technology, direct air capture is a technology that removes carbon dioxide molecules directly from the atmosphere. 
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Listen in as Senior Engineer Jim Bielenberg explains how direct air capture works by using its internal surface to lower the concentration of co2, and the similarities it shares with the carbon capture and storage process. Direct air capture is a long-term technology designed to help lower emissions in a fast-paced energy transition.
  
 

  Learn more about carbon capture storage safety: https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/delivering-industrial-solutions/carbon-capture-and-storage/carbon-capture-storage-safety

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil’s Permian Basin operations are getting electric vehicles as part of our EV pilot program with Chevy.
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Watch to learn how our EV pilot program can help lower costs and co2 emissions. The Permian pickups will be used by mechanics, lease operators, and others whose jobs involve getting themselves (and equipment) to and from various sites in New Mexico and Texas. This pilot program will be contributing to our plan of achieving net zero emissions in our Permian operations by 2030. 
  
 

  Learn more about our work in the Permian Basin: 
  https://corporate.exxonmobil.com/what-we-do/energy-supply/permian-basin-reliable-energy-net-zero-purpose

post_body_text:
ExxonMobil and Toyota are working together to explore future lower emission fuel solutions.  
  
 

  Subscribe now: https://www.youtube.com/user/exxonmobil?sub_confirmation=1
  
 

  Watch to learn how ExxonMobil and Toyota have been testing innovative research fuels, advanced engines, and vehicles to demonstrate that lower emission fuels are technically feasible. Recent tests have confirmed that lower emission fuels can also be compatible with today’s vehicles, which can potentially reduce greenhouse gas emissions by up to 75% versus conventional vehicles. 
  
 

  Learn more about our work with Toyota:
  https://corporate.exxonmobil.com//what-we-do/transforming-transportation/lower-emission-fuels/Fueling-Americas-future-Toyota-lowering-emissions
